availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James G. Carter (Campbell County, Kentucky, stone mason and attorney)

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, stone mason and attorney. Ohio native. Married Charlotte Carter. Father of Thomas Carter, Mary A. Carter, Eliza F. Carter, Leroy Carter, and Sarah J. Carter. Stone mason in Campbell County in 1850. Attorney in Campbell County in 1860. Resident of Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1863.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, District 2, p. 105; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, p. 147; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Voting District 6, p. 94; KYR-0001-029-0507; KYR-0001-029-0544.
